TEI.2.document_title: Thomas Westall to Jared E. Groce, 03-05-1825 03-19-1825

barker_notes.barker_summary: Thomas Westall to Jared E. Groce, March 5, 1825. Commerce.
barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 2, pp. 1055

div1.p: Thomas Westall to Jared E. Groce, March 5, 1825. Commerce.

Sir Mr. Talley will call on you for the corn and Bacon—you told me you would let me have be so good as to send it by him and I will pay you the money when cald for aliso pleas send 4 Bushels for Capt Davis and Sartan too Gentlemen that came with me to this place and I will pay you for it
Recd of the with in ten dollars in cash from S. F. Austin
Recd. of Mr. Groce ten bushels of corn—for Mr. Westall—which I promise to deliver to him in San Felipe de Austin— David Tally
